result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Szewczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Szewczyk

records.addlTxt: to Court from Agent Algrem w/Order for Civil Judgment
on Petition for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations s/BNB/3-15-18

Case calls 14CF21 & 14CF41.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Robert J. Szewczyk. . Attorney Chad A. Hendee appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Dave Ahlbrem appears for Probation and Parole by phone.  Dave Ahlbrem requests civil judgment of $775.10 at this time, gives reasons.  District Attorney Hendee makes statements.  Attorney Frank requests civil judgment at this time. 

By the Court:  finds good faith effort made at this time. Finds appropriate for civil judgment $775.10.  Probation period will expire as ordered previously.

Probation review hearing on March 15, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

Probation & Parole Notice mailed to Wautoma office - 2/27/18 kmk

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J. Szewczyk in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF21 & 14CF41:
Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 14CF21 and Ct. 1 in 14CF41.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed in 14CF21.  The State agrees not to file charges in 12-SO3145 & 12-SO3608 based on the plea today.  Atty Frank agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF21 and Ct. 1 in 14CF41.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed in 14CF21.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  14CF21 - Ct. 1 and 14CF41 - Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
9 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Ct. 1 in 14CF21
Report forthwith
May transfer to Waushara County
Good Time
Huber will include medical appointments
Electronic Monitoring
Pay $600 + costs = $1,494.00
36 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

14CF41 - Court Costs = $268.00
14CF21 - Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Return date on October 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Atty Hendee files the information for both 14CF21 & 14CF41.
  Defendant received a copy of the information in both cases & waives the reading.  Atty Frank enters a Not Guilty plea in 14CF21 & 14CF41.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered for both cases.
Set for Return.
bond continued in both matters.

Defendant Robert Joseph Szewczyk in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF21 & 14CF41:
Atty Hendee states that both matters have not had a Prelim waiver yet.  Atty Frank agrees and states that the defendant will waive his right to a Preliminary Hearing on both cases.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the Prelim waiver.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed on 14CF21 & 14CF41 and this defendant committed it.  Cases bound over for trial or further proceedings.
  Return date scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on September 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Return date on July 30, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Robert Joseph Szewczyk in court with attorney Ryan T Frank.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF21 & 14CF41:
Atty Hendee states that Atty Frank will be filing a motion for collateral attack on 14CF21 and asks that 14CF41 track with that case.  Court questions Atty Frank.  Atty Frank agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Motion hearing.
14CF41 will track with 14CF21  
Motion hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Return date on June 25, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Robert Joseph Szewczyk in court with attorney Ryan T Frank.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Frank waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Requests return date be set.
BY THE COURT:  That will be scheduled.  Bond to continue.  Return date scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Initial appearance on May 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert Joseph Szewczyk not in court.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has another case that Atty Frank is on.  Atty Hendee asks the court to set this with his other case.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to track with the defendant's other case.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
